name: Dreams Huatulco Resort & Spa

reviews.text: I went to Dreams Hutulco for the second half of my trip (4 nights), and to say I was blown away would be an understatement!!! This property covers almost all bases and does so with such a high level of presentation, you would be hard pressed to come back with many (if any) complaints. for the sake of giving full details though I will try my best!
reviews.title: Believe the hype! Best resort in Huatulco! Will return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good:
reviews.title: Loved Dreams, already planning to go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Almost everything! But in all seriousness this property is amazing. With multiple infinity pools overlooking the ocean, great bar service and drink selection, and the beach itself, it's hard not to enjoy the sun or just relax. Also on site are sports and spa facilities that are among the best I have seen (being able to tour the spa facility I can tell you it is quite modern and is worth it if you have extra cash to spend!).
reviews.title: LOVED DREAMS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinning is equally amazing. I had the chance to eat at the buffet for breakfast (great options all around!), lunch, and dinner. I also was able to enjoy both the Italian and Asian a la cartes while there which were also top notch (though if I had to pick one the Italian was better). Huatulco is still mainly a destination that caters to locals of Mexico, so from time to time while at the restaurants or bars a request may have been lost in translation, but the staff is eager to fix any mistakes and make it right, so that was all I could ask for. Most of the staff is fluent in English and are willing to step in and help.
reviews.title: Dreams Huatulco is excellent
great hotel
reviews.text: The rooms themselves are 5 star all the way. Very clean, moden design, comfy beds and a flat screen TV make up the main bedroom area. The bathrooms are equally clean and modern with a large rainfall style shower head, and separate cleaning hose with it's own seperate water temperature adjustment. Two sinks and big bottles of soap, shampoo, lotion, and sunscreen are provided as well.

Dreams Huatulco has a superb location on a beach that is safe for deep water swimming. However, very weak swimmers and small children should be cautious of the waves which can pull you out of your depth very quickly. Dreams now employs life guards, one of whom, Jorge is very conscientious and efficient at his job. But when the season starts, one life guard may not be enough.
reviews.title: Dreams vis a vis Gala; Preferred Club or Economy?

reviews.text: The bedrooms are as wonderfully luxurious as previous reviews have stated. (Do you spend your whole day in a room when you go on a beach holiday?) And the hotel and the beach are very clean. I would say compared to the ambience of the Gala , Dreams is sanitized, sun-baked and minimalist, and the food tastes bland. The chiefs are new and the management is maybe going for more neutral North American taste buds.
reviews.title: What a dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Portofino: Eating in the new Italian restaurant is like eating in a badly lit morgue. Gone are the cosy seats, romantic lighting and ersatz Italian paintings --- as is the Italian chef. I had bland fish which I recognized the next day in the lunch buffet offering. The mushroom soup had a strange taste. I don't usually order Japanese style mushroom soup when I go to an Italian restaurant.
reviews.title: Dreams Resort Huatulco is a paradise on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: El Patio:The Mexican restaurant has retained its decor and the food is alright. I fancy the chef is a bit heavy on the chile when making his soups. I add that we adore Mexican food and have lived in Mexico. Gone is the dessert trolley (not that we needed it!) and the wonderful dessert coffees made with show and skill in front of the happy diners.
reviews.title: Great Experience...Minus the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oceana: Bring a flashlight for the seafood restaurant if you eat there at night. The lighted side has the pallor of a police station, but at least you can see your food and the menu. My fish reminded me of fish fingers for children and the sauce had the texture and taste of Ketchup.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I want to write a review before I forget all of the details of our great experience at Dreams Huatulco, but while my review will probably mostly just reinforce the comments others have made, I want to repay the others for what we learned in this review forum.
reviews.title: Loved Dreams - We will return

reviews.text: First of all I think that Dreams and the Barcelo hotel have the best locations because of their beach access. Our room was always less than a 5 minute walk from any pool or any place on the beach in front of the hotel - that's hard to beat. The restaurants, bars, and restrooms are always within a short distance. We stayed during the very end of the slow season and watched the hotel capacity change from about 30% to about 50% and were told that it would probably go to 100% by 12/19. So while times were supposedly slow we did see towels being placed on poolside chairs early, but not too early. Guests and occasionally hotel staff would remove towels from chairs unoccupied for extended periods. We also noticed people that left the pool area, never to return, that did not remove their towels...shame on them!
reviews.title: Dream in Huatulco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, our vacation started after a terribly long trip from SFO->MEX-HUX that took 18 hours (with delays, etc). At MEX we spent a long time and lots of lines and backtracking to find the secret glass doors that we needed to go thru for immigration. Then our domestic departure gate "B" turned out to not be a gate after all but an entire area of the airport. On our return flight our gate changed at the last minute to one at the other end of the airport - a 20 minute walk. I know this not Dreams resort specific, but I recommend avoiding MEX airport if at all possible.
reviews.title: It's a Pleasure

reviews.text: At HUX, customs was quick and easy. We went thru to find our way out and had no idea how to get to the hotel except that Dreams was supposed to send someone. By chance somebody from Apple (we had never heard of Apple) asked us where we were going and it turned out he was there to pick us up. As we later learned, Apple is the reservation company for those booking at Dreams Huatulco thru the US. Twenty minutes later our arrival at Dreams was pleasant. We were greeted with a fruit punch and cold towels. Check in took about 15 minutes. Fortunately our room was ready (it was only noon and check-in time is 3pm) as we went a night without sleep and were wiped-out. The lobby is open air and consists of a few check-in/check-out desks, the lobby bar, the apple and signature reps, and the concierge desks. We had a preferred club ocean view room so we were on the 5th floor of the main building (3). The concierge service was incredible and helped us out on a daily basis.
reviews.title: Dreams a good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel, pools, and beach are incredible - sparkling clean. The staff works non-stop, sweeping and cleaning to make everything an exceptional experience. Swimming in the ocean here was good. Dozens of large fish are right there with you hoping for a handout. The jellyfish flag was up only on one day. We had heard about mosquito problems but it wasn't until near the end of our 10 day stay that we experienced it. As the hotel became more crowded we decided to go to the pool earlier than usual one day. Possibly by coincidence the landscape maintenance staff was shaking the dead leaves out the poolside trees. Dozens of blood-sucking insects attacked us. They were smaller than CA size mosquitos but about the size of gnats. We had repellant with us, but by the time we were able to apply it, the damage was done. Welts. We saw several other guests covered with welts, but with the exception of that one experience we had no problems.
reviews.title: Very Nice AI

reviews.text: Dreams is the most new, and updated hotel in Huatulco. The other hotels, 2 other hotels, that are somewhat comparable would be the Barcelo or Las Brisas...., but they really aren't as new and updated, as Dreams is. The Rooms ...are fantastic. The other reviews i read are true.The beds are fantastic, decent linens,and very comfy...The bathrooms are new, and modern, with great fixtures.The toiet flushes, and the "rain" showers are perfect. Rooms are cleaned well.My good friend and i had separate rooms, in the preferred area, well worth it. The mini bar was always stalked with plenty of bottled water, and bottled mineral water, and pop, etc...This resort, if you are looking for a 5 star is the closest you will get in Huatulco, as the Brisas and Barcelo, are showing there "age".....People also must remember, AI's are never really 5 star, The Four Seasons, and W, and Fairmont hotels, are 5 star... to North americans, who can afford to stay in them. But for Mexico, this hotel is more than Adequate, for a picky North American Traveller. The food actually was pretty good. We all have such different opinions on what we like, but like i said, this resort is more than adequate, so there is always something for everyone in the buffets, or menus. We both met lots of people, and really everyone at the resort, had good things to say about it.....The Wi- Fi, internet in the rooms, was the only little annoying thing, as it was variable....but then again, in North America, we are used to great wireless....The sand flies at the beach, are the worst in the morning, so best to wait, til the sun is hot, and they disappear. The pools are clean, and refreshing, and the waitresses work hard, and if you tip them, regularly throughout the day, your service gets better. The lobby bar is great, the guys work hard there, and it is a great place to sip a drink with friends, before or after dinner. If you are a traveller that has lots of questions or nervous about booking hotels when traveling to Mexico, pay the extra money for Dreams, it really will be the smart choice, as the other hotels, in the area, are showing there age. I have stayed in other hotels in Huatulco, and this hotel will give you the best value, and will satisfy the most particular, traveler.My friend and i talked to lots of people at the pool each day, and no one had anything really negative to say about it. The weather is hot and sunny, but i think this year, a few more clouds have moved through, as it is an el nino year, so weather everywhere is off. We had perfect weather up until the last 2 days, but the clouds rolled in a bit more, which is weird for Huatulco, but no rain, and the sun would come and go, so nothing really to complain about. Overall dreams to me was a great choice, if you want a low key, quiet vacation. There is not alot to do in Huatulco, compared to other Mexican destinations, but it is ideal to relax, and rest, and get away from crumby cold north american winters.....
reviews.title: most updated resort in Huatulco...BY FAR!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the first two weeks of December in the astonishing town of Huatulco in Mexico. As an area, I'd love to tell you how awful it is, just so nobody else goes there. But I'm going to have to tell the truth: it is one of the most wonderful places I've ever been to. We stayed at Dreams, booking the Ocean View Preferred Club room. We had 3533, which is in tower 3.
reviews.title: Wonderful, if they just fix a few niggles.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the airport and were a little concerned at the lack of our transfer car - we'd been told by email to look for the rep with the Amstar sign but there isn't one. Nobody tells you this, but you have to find the Apple rep. We were a little concerned, but laughed it off. The weather at this point was as we enjoyed for the whole fortnight - glorious, hot weather. On arrival, the helpful concierge staff shepherded us to the check-in area. They eyed our confirmation worriedly and after a few minutes, asked us if we had booked the Honeymoon package. We had (we got married a couple of months earlier but had to wait to be able to afford such a trip) but they had forgotten to prepare our room. We'd expected rose petals, towels made into kissing swans, a fruit bowl and champagne, topped off with a door sash proclaiming our honeymoon status. We got none of this. Oh well, off we went to check out the resort. As it happened, the honeymoon package was put in the room at 11pm while we were in the bar. We arrived, tired and jet-lagged after a few drinks and didn't really get the impact of the presentation. The champagne remained un-drunk for a couple of days.
reviews.title: BEST VACATION EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The position of Dreams is incredible - the view from our room was breathtaking and we were pleased with the position. Walking around the resort we quickly located most of the swimming pools, the bars and the restaurants. All are positioned well, are clean and air-conditioned.
reviews.title: Dreams Wah-Tool-Co, Our Best Family Holiday Yet

reviews.text: Returning to our room, we noticed a loud whirring noise coming from a large fan above reception. This was clearly audible from our room, 24-hours a day. We ignored it, but I can imagine it annoying most people. The bathroom in the rooms is nice, with a large powerful shower. The posh toiletries were a Preferred club upgrade and my wife was pleased with them. The mini-bar was poorly stocked and the re-stocks seemed random. One day we'd get two beers, the next we'd get four. One day there'd be spirits, the next there would not.
reviews.title: Wow! What a Great, Relaxing Trip!

description: Spectacular resort offering 421 luxurious rooms and suites, 6 shimmering outdoor pools, 6 restaurants and 6 bars, SPA & fitness center and endless activities for couples and families.
